# Methodology
Convergence and estimation stability are measured by the number of successful NUTS estimation runs in relation to the total number of runs.

# Model 1
```{r}
# model
m <- c("baseline",
       "two classes",
       "two classes",
       "two classes",
       "three classes",
       "three classes",
       "three classes",
       "two classes")

# model_modification
m_modification <- c("","","","","","ident. err.","","")

# dataset
ds <- c("1","2","3","4","5","6","6","16")

# observed_dependent_variable
Y_obs <- c("Yobs",
           "Yobs",
           "Yobs",
           "Yobs",
           "Yobs",
           "Yobs",
           "Yobs",
           "Yobslog")

# convergence stability
conv_stability <- c("5 / 5",
                    "4 / 5",
                    "2 / 5",
                    "4 / 5",
                    "2 / 5",
                    "4 / 5",
                    "5 / 5",
                    "5 / 5")

# estimation stability 
est_stability <- c("5 / 5",
                   "4 / 5",
                   "2 / 5",
                   "4 / 5",
                   "2 / 5",
                   "4 / 5",
                   "5 / 5",
                   "5 / 5")

df <- data.frame(m,
                 m_modification,
                 ds,
                 Y_obs,
                 conv_stability,
                 est_stability)

names(df) <- c("Model",
               "Model modification",
               "Dataset",
               "Observed dependent variable",
               "Convergence stability",
               "Estimation stability")

flextable(df)
```
